story: Every night at exactly midnight, the books in the town library came alive. The fairy tale books would act out their stories, the science books would conduct experiments, and the poetry books would recite verses to the moon. Oliver, a young boy who couldn't sleep, discovered this secret when he snuck into the library one night. The books welcomed him and taught him wonderful things until dawn. But the head librarian book told Oliver that he could only visit if he promised to read more during the day and share stories with other children. Oliver kept his promise and became the best storyteller in his school.
story_summary: A sleepless boy discovers that library books come alive at midnight and learns the importance of reading and sharing stories.
